comment: Marlon is a really wonderful guy, but he is kinda all over the place as a professor. He didn't give a syllabus all semester (against KSU policy), didn't give clear criteria for the assignments or due dates. Also, wasnt there 7 times even though if students miss 2 classes we get docked a letter grade. Easy grader though, just a bit frustrating

Genuinely one of the worst professors. He never clearly told us what he wanted for his assignments or how they would be graded. We literally never got a syllabus for the class. Very unaccessible outside of class or through email. He doesn't teach, leaves class and hands it over to TA. Just a terrible professor. His class was a huge waste of time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Marlon is a super kind guy and a great professor. He gives great industry advice and we learned a variety of different forms of creation and performance. You are encouraged to participate. He creates a supportive and safe environment and is always sure to check in on comfort levels. This class was a great introduction to the TPS program.
